title: Will Smith was the inspo behind Martin Bashir doing X Factor: Celebrity
text:
Martin took inspo from Will Smith when singing as a kid (Picture: Getty/Rex)

Martin Bashir may be known for his documentaries – but he’s about to take on a whole new task as a singer on Celebrity X Factor.

And if you’re wondering what gave him the inspo for a singing career, he’s revealed it’s all down to the Fresh Prince himself, Will Smith.

The 56-year-old will be trying his luck against the likes of Megan McKenna, a band of Love Islanders and Ricki Lake to be named celebrity champion…most of which have some kind of background in music.

So speaking about why he decided to take on the challenge, he said: ‘Some years back, whenever we were driving long distances, I would put a song by Will Smith called Getting Jiggy With It onto the CD player and start singing.

‘They’d say, “Please Mum, tell him to shut up”. I think they found it embarrassing.’

So is he prepared to leave his family cringing again? And, more importantly, is he going to be bringing those sweet, sweet, rap skills to the audition room?

‘Well it depends on how embarrassing the performance is!,’ he said. ‘If it’s an absolute disaster and I go out in the first round, they will probably say something like, “You’re stupid. You should never have done it”.’

How’s Martin going to fare in front of the judges? (Picture: SyCo)

How his efforts pay off will be revealed soon enough – with the first round of auditions launching this weekend.

It seems whatever happened was a bit of a wake-up call for the journalist, who until taking part had never professionally performed.

More: The X Factor Simon Cowell's success secrets: How he will make a star on X Factor: Celebrity The X Factor Celebrity puts spotlight on line up in new glam shots Robbie Williams records theme song for Christmas Special of The Tiger Who Came To Tea

‘It’s not as easy as you think. It’s hard,’ he said. ‘I’d never recognised how extraordinarily skilled singers are. I had no idea. I love music. I’d go to classical concerts, jazz, pop, whatever.

‘But this has been like an education because I had no idea.’

The X Factor Celebrity starts this Saturday at 8.35pm on ITV1.
